1.t: The Hour of Doom is drawing near and the moon is rent asunder.

2.t: Whenever they see a miracle, they turn away from it and say, "This is just a powerful magic".
2.tr: Wa-ien yaraw aayataien yu'ridoo Wa-yaqooloo sihrun mustamirr

3.t: They have rejected it and have followed their own desires, but all matters will be settled (by God).
3.tr: Wa-kazzaboo wattaba'ooo ahwaaa'ahum; Wa-kullu amrin mustaqirr

4.t: They have certainly received the kind of news in which there is a lesson and strong words of wisdom,
4.tr: Wa-laqad jaaa'ahum minal anbaaa'i maa feehi muzdajar

5.t: but the warnings have proved to have no effect on them.

6.t: (Muhammad), leave them alone. On the day when they will be called to a terrible punishment,
6.tr: Fatawalla 'anhum; yawma yad'ud daa'i ilaa shai-'in nukur

7.t: they will come out of their graves, their eyes cast down, hastening towards their Summoner as locusts rushing about.
7.tr: Khushsha'an absaaruhum yakhrujoona minal ajdaasi ka-annahum jaraadum muntashir

8.t: These disbelievers will say, "This is a hard day".
8.tr: Muhti'eena ilad daa'i yaqoolul kaafiroona haazaa yawmun 'asir

9.t: The people of Noah, who lived before them, had also rejected (Our guidance). They rejected Our servant and said, "He is an insane person so let us drive him away".
9.tr: Kazzabat qablahum qawmu Noohin fakazzaboo 'abdanaa Wa-qaaloo majnoonunw wazdujir

10.t: Noah prayed, "Lord, help me; I am defeated".

11.t: We opened the gates of the sky and water started to pour down.

12.t: We caused the earth to burst forth with springs so that the waters could come together for a predestined purpose.
12.tr: Wa-fajjarnal arda 'uyoonan faltaqal maaa'u 'alaaa amrin qad qudir

13.t: We carried him, (Noah), on a vessel built with boards fixed together with nails,

14.t: which floated on the water before Our very eyes. The flood was a recompense for the deeds of the disbelievers.
14.tr: Tajree bi-a'yuninaa jazaaa'an liman kaana kufir

15.t: We made (the story of Noah) as evidence of the Truth. However, is there anyone who would take heed?
15.tr: Wa-laqat taraknaahaa aayatan fahal min muddakir

16.t: How terrible was My torment and the result of (their disregard) of My warning.

17.t: We have made the Quran easy to understand, but is there anyone who would pay attention?
17.tr: Wa-laqad yassarnal Qur'aana liz-zikri fahal min muddakir

18.t: The people of `Ad rejected Our guidance. How terrible was My torment and the result (of their disregard) of My warning.

19.t: On an unfortunate day We sent upon them a continuous violent wind
19.tr: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim reehan sarsaran fee Yawmi nahsin mustamirr

20.t: which hurled people around like uprooted trunks of palm-trees.
20.tr: Tanzi'un naasa ka-annahum a'jaazu nakhlin munqa'ir

21.t: How terrible was Our torment and the result of (their disregard) of Our warning.

22.t: We have made the Quran easy to understand, but is there anyone who would pay attention?
22.tr: Wa-laqad yassarnal Qur'aana liz-zikri fahal min muddakir

23.t: The people of Thamud rejected Our warnings.

24.t: They said, "Should we follow only one person among us. We shall be clearly in error and in trouble (if we do so).
24.tr: Faqaalooo a'-basharan minnaa waahidan nattabi'uhooo innaa izal lafee dalaalinw Wa-su'ur

25.t: How is it that he has received guidance? In fact, he is the most untruthfull and arrogant person".
25.tr: A-ulqiyaz zikru 'alaihi min baininaa bal huwa kazzaabun ashir

26.t: (We told Salih), "Tomorrow they will know who is the most arrogant liar.

27.t: We are sending the she-camel to them to test them. So watch them and be patient.
27.tr: Innaa mursilun naaqati fitnatan lahum fartaqibhum wastabir

28.t: Tell them that each one of them has the right to have a certain share of water".
28.tr: Wa-nabbi'hum annal maaa'a qismatun bainahum kullu shirbin muhtadar

29.t: They called together their companions and agreed to slay the she-camel.

30.t: How terrible was My punishment and warning.

31.t: We sent upon them a single blast of sound and they were left like hay to be used by the cattle.
31.tr: Innaaa arsalnaa 'alaihim saihatanw waahidatan fakaanoo kahasheemil muhtazir

32.t: We made the Quran easy to understand, but is there anyone who would take heed?
32.tr: Wa-laqad yassarnal Qur'aana liz-zikri fahal min muddakir

33.t: The people of Lot rejected Our warning.

34.t: We sent down upon them a violent sandstorm (which destroyed them all) except for the family of Lot, whom We saved in the early morning by Our favor.
34.tr: Innaa arsalnaa 'alaihim haasiban illaaa aala Lootin najjainaahum bisahar

35.t: Thus do We recompense the grateful ones.
35.tr: Ni'matan min 'indinaa; kazaalika najzee man shakar

36.t: Lot warned them against Our torment, but they persistently disputed it.

37.t: They demanded that he turn over his guests to them.
37.tr: Wa-laqad raawadoohu 'an daifeehee fatamasnaaa a'yunahum fazooqoo 'azaabee Wa-nuzur

38.t: We struck their faces, blinded them and said, "Suffer Our torment of which you were warned".

39.t: One early morning Our torment brought upon them utter destruction. We said, "Suffer Our torment of which you were warned".

40.t: We have made the Quran easy to understand, but is there anyone who would pay attention?
40.tr: Wa-laqad yassarnal Qur'aana liz-zikri fahal min muddakir

41.t: The Pharaoh and his people had also received Our warning,

42.t: but they rejected all Our miracles. So We seized them in the way that a Majestic and All-powerful One would.
42.tr: Kazzaboo bi-Aayaatinaa kullihaa fa-akhaznaahum akhza 'azeezim muqtadir

43.t: Are you disbelievers mightier than those of the nations which We destroyed before or have you received amnesty through the ancient Scriptures?
43.tr: A-kuffaarukum khairun min ulaaa'ikum am lakum baraaa'atun fiz Zubur

44.t: Do they say, "We shall be victorious because we are united?"

45.t: (Let them know that) this united group will soon run away in defeat.

46.t: In fact, the Hour of Doom is the time for them to suffer. The suffering of this hour is the most calamitous and the most bitter (of all suffering).
46.tr: Balis Saa'atu maw'iduhum was-Saa'atu adhaa Wa-amarr

47.t: The sinful ones will face the destructive torment of hell

48.t: when they will be dragged on their faces into the fire and will be told, "Feel the touch of hell".
48.tr: Yawma yus-haboona fin Naari 'alaa wujoohihim zooqoo massa saqar

49.t: We have created everything to fulfill a certain purpose.

50.t: It takes only a single command from Us (to bring the Day of Judgment) and that can be achieved within the twinkling of an eye.
50.tr: Wa-maaa amrunaaa illaa waahidatun ka-lamhin bil-basar

51.t: We destroyed many people like you (disbelievers) but is there anyone who would take heed (of Our warning)?
51.tr: Wa-laqad ahlaknaaa ashyaa'akum fahal min muddakir

52.t: Whatever they have done has been recorded in the Books (records of the deeds).

53.t: Every small or great deed is written down.

54.t: The pious ones will live in Paradise wherein streams flow,

55.t: honorably seated in the presence of the All-dominant King.
